1: Design garden to plant seeds in rows
2: Buy seeds from a garden centre
3: Ensure garden has at least 6 hours sunlight a day
5: Dig a shallow trench to plant the seeds
6: Cover seeds and mark the row
7: Provide more water for the first time
9: Add fertilizer based on instructions on the bag

1: Choose a spot with at least 6 hours sunlight/day
2: Buy a pot (10-20 cm) with drainage holes
3: Use new and damp potting mix as soil
4: Bury the seeds deep enough to contact soil
5: Add water to keep the soil moist but not soggy
6: Add fertilizer once two leaves sprout
7: Cut the extra plant growth at the soil line
8: Use cotton swab to remove pollens or dirt
9: Transfer seedling outdoors to encourage growth

1: Design garden to plant in rows
2: Ensure garden has at least 6 hours sunlight a day
5: Transfer the plant from pot to the trench
6: Provide more water for the first time
8: Add fertilizer based on instructions on the bag
